sen.e: Revision of land-tax reform.
Investigation into the land-tax reform
sen.cmt: このセクションでは、廃藩置県が行われる前に抜本的な地租改正の実施を検討していた時期について書いているわけですから、「Revision」ふさわしくないと思います。
sen.e: Investigation into the land-tax reform

sen.j: 明治初期から大蔵省や民部省では、全ての土地に賦課して一定の額を金納させる新しい税制である地租の導入が検討されていた。
sen.e: From Meiji period Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) and Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) tried to introduce the land-tax which was a new tax system where a certain amount of money was collected by levy on all lands.

From the beginning of the Meiji period officials in the Okurasho (the Ministry of Finance) and the Minbusho (the Ministry of Civil Affairs) were investigating into the implementation of the new tax system in which all the land would be levied and in which the government would make people pay in cash a fixed amount of tax.
sen.cmt: この文における大蔵省は明治時代から2000年まで存在した大蔵省のことですから、「the Ministry of Finance」となります。民部省も明治政府における民部省を指します。民部省の訳には「the Ministry of Civil Affairs」、「the Ministry of People's Affairs」、「Ministry of Popular Affairs」と複数用語集に登録されていますが、明治政府における民部省の訳は、「the Ministry of Civil Affairs」だと思います。
sen.e: From the beginning of the Meiji period officials in the Okurasho (the Ministry of Finance) and the Minbusho (the Ministry of Civil Affairs) were investigating into the implementation of the new tax system in which all the land would be levied and in which the government would make people pay in cash a fixed amount of tax.

sen.j: また、神田孝平も、に「田租改革建議」を提出して各藩ごとの税の不均衡を正して公正な税制にするための貢租改革が提案されていた。
sen.e: And Takahira KANDA also suggested koso reform in order to make a fair tax system by correcting the disparity of taxes of each Domain, submitting 'Proposal for denso reform.'
In 1870 Takahira KANDA also submitted 'A Proposal for Land-Tax Reform'; in the proposal he suggested to correct inequality in taxes among domains and make a fair tax system.
sen.cmt: 原文には「各藩ごとの」とありますが、意味するところは藩によって税金の基準が違うという意味ですから、直訳は避けたほうがいいと思います。また、「land tax」 は「明治以前にはtaso (denso)や「koso」とも呼ばれていたと前のパラグラフで読者に説明していますから、ここでこれらの用語を使う必要はないと思います。
sen.e: In 1870 Takahira KANDA also submitted 'A Proposal for Land-Tax Reform'; in the proposal he suggested to correct inequality in taxes among domains and make a fair tax system.

sen.j: だが、土地の賦課の是非は大名などの領主の権限と考えられていたこと、従来の検地に代わる大規模な測量の必要性があることから、政府内でも賛否両論があってまとまらなかった。
sen.e: However, as the pros and cons of land taxation was considered to be in the authority of landlords such as daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and so on and it was necessary to do a large-scale survey instead of traditional land survey, the proposal did not see the solution in the government because of discussion both for and against.

However, this proposal was not put into practice because there were arguments for and against within the government; the main reasons for the opposition lied in that at that time it was believed that the authority to impose land tax or not lied in the feudal lords such as daimyo and that it was necessary to conduct a large scale land survey replacing the existing nationwide land survey before getting into the land-tax reform.

sen.j: だが、、に廃藩置県が行われると、日本からは領主が一掃される形となり、反対論の大きな理由が失われた。
sen.e: However, Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) was done in 1871 and landlords in Japan were cleared away and a big reason of objection disappeared.
sen.cmt: 「、、に」とありますが、廃藩置県なので、「１８７１年に」と解釈しました。

sen.j: 経過

Progress
sen.cmt: 用語集には「Progress」と「Process」が両方登録されていますが、後続の文に「この地租改正は約7年にわたる大事業であった」と書いてありますから、「Progress」がより正確な訳だと思います。
sen.e: Progress

sen.j: 7月28日に地租改正法（上諭と地代の3％を地租とする旨を記載した1ヶ条で構成）と具体的な規定を定めた地租改正条例などから成る太政官布告第272号が制定され、明治政府は翌年から地租改正に着手した。
sen.e: Dajokan fukoku (proclamation by the Grand Council of State) No. 272, which consists of law of land-tax reform (consisting of the one article describing the landlords' order and land rent 3％) and regulation of land-tax reform which designates specific regulations and so on, was designated and Meiji government started land-tax reform from next year.

In July 28, 1873, the Meiji government promulgated the Ordinance of Dajokan No.272 which consisted of the Land Tax Reform Law (made up of an imperial edict and one article stating the land tax will be 3% of the cash value of the land) and the regulation of land-tax reform in which concrete rules were laid down; in the following year the government started the land-tax reform.
sen.cmt: 「上諭」の訳が間違っています。なおウィキピデアの「地租改正」の項目をチェックしたところ、文のはじめの7月28日の前に1873年と書いてありましたので、写し漏れと解釈し、「1873」を訳文に入れました。
sen.e: In July 28, 1873, the Meiji government promulgated the Ordinance of Dajokan No.272 which consisted of the Land Tax Reform Law (made up of an imperial edict and one article stating the land tax will be 3% of the cash value of the land) and the regulation of land-tax reform in which concrete rules were laid down; in the following year the government started the land-tax reform.

sen.j: 政府は当初、検地が農民からの反発を受けることを懸念し、農民からの自己申告主義を採った。
sen.e: At first the government was afraid that land survey would receive the objection from farmers and thus applied farmers' self-enumeration policy.
The government initially ordered individual farmers to report details on their land because the government was concerned about farmers' objection on the nationwide land survey.
sen.cmt: 耳慣れない「self-enumeration」のような語句は避けたほうがいいと思います。
sen.e: The government initially ordered individual farmers to report details on their land because the government was concerned about farmers' objection on the nationwide land survey.

sen.j: すなわち、農民自らが地押丈量を行い、面積・収量を算出し、地方庁は地方官心得書の検査例に基づいて点検し、これを経て地方庁が地券（改正地券）を発行するかたちをとった。
sen.e: That is, farmers themselves did chioshi-joryo (measurement of land), calculated square footage and amount of crop and the intendance inspected according to examinations by chihokan (a local official) documents and through this the intendance issued the certificate of land title (revised one).

That is, the government adopted the method in which farmers to measure the plots of their land themselves, calculate their yield, and submit the results to local tax officials and the local officials were to examine the reports based on the previous examples described in the instruction book and upon the completion of this inspection, the local office was to issue the new land certificate.
sen.cmt: 主語は農民ではなく政府です。
sen.e: That is, the government adopted the method in which farmers to measure the plots of their land themselves, calculate their yield, and submit the results to local tax officials and the local officials were to examine the reports based on the previous examples described in the instruction book and upon the completion of this inspection, the local office was to issue the new land certificate.

sen.j: しかしこの方法では、全国一律公平の租税を徴収する目的は達しがたく、また、の改租結果から、目標の租税額が確保できそうにないことが明らかとなった。
sen.e: However, it was difficult for this method to reach the goal to collect uniform and fair taxes throughout the country and by the result of tax revision it becomes clear not to be able to secure the target amount of taxes.
sen.cmt: 「また、の」とありますが、単に「また、」と解釈しました。
sen.e: However, it became clear that it was difficult for the government to reach the goal of collecting land tax uniformly and fairly throughout the country and that the result of the land-tax reform of 1874 made the government know that it was difficult for the government to secure the amount of land tax it had aimed at.
sen.cmt: 時制に問題があります。また、ウィキペディアの「地租改正」をチェックすると、「また、」と「の」の間に「1874年」が入っていましたので、写し漏れと解釈し、「1874年」を入れて訳しました。
sen.e: However, it became clear that it was difficult for the government to reach the goal of collecting land tax uniformly and fairly throughout the country and that the result of the land-tax reform of 1874 made the government know that it was difficult for the government to secure the amount of land tax it had aimed at.

sen.j: また、政府高官間の政争の産物である「大蔵省分割問題」も影を落としていた（内務省_(日本)設置による測量機構と税額算定機構の分離）。
sen.e: Also, there was the influence of 'the problem of partitioning Okura-sho' which was the product of political dispute among high government officials (separation of surveying system established by Ministry of Interior (Japan) and tax-calculating system).

In addition, the problem of 'dividing the Ministry of Finance' cast a shadow into the land-tax reform; that is, the organization responsible for the land survey and the organization responsible for calculating amount of tax were separated owing to the establishing of the Ministry of Home Affairs; this split was the product of the political dispute.
sen.cmt: 明治時代から終戦まであった「内務省」は「the Ministry of Home Affairs」です。 また「大蔵省」も訳したほうがいいと思います。

sen.j: このため政府は、、に内務省及び大蔵省の両省間に地租改正事務局を設置し、これを中心として改租を強力に進めるよう方針転換した（明治8年太政官達第38号）。
sen.e: For this reason, the government established a land-tax revision office between Ministry of Interior and Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) and centering on this, changed the policy to strongly advance the tax reform (Dajokan tasshi (proclamation by the Grand Council of State) No. 38 in 1875).
sen.cmt: 「、、に」を訳出しないようにしました。
sen.e: For this reason, the government founded the Land Tax Bureau between the Ministry of Home Affairs and the Ministry of Finace in1875 and changed its policy to moving agressively for advancing the land-tax reform centering on the newly created Land Tax Reform Bureau (No. 32 of the Transmittal of Dajokan [Grand Council of State] of 1875).
sen.cmt: 「内務省」と「大蔵省」の訳が間違っています（この文章は明治時代の内務省と大蔵省について書いています。） また、ウィキペデアの「地租改正」をチェックすると、「このため政府は、」と「、」の間に「1875年」が入っていますので、写し漏れと解釈し、「1875年」を入れて訳しました
sen.e: For this reason, the government founded the Land Tax Bureau between the Ministry of Home Affairs and the Ministry of Finace in1875 and changed its policy to moving agressively for advancing the land-tax reform centering on the newly created Land Tax Reform Bureau (No. 32 of the Transmittal of Dajokan [Grand Council of State] of 1875).

sen.j: このなかで、府県庁は地租改正事務局があらかじめ見当をつけた平均反収を絶対的な査定条件とし、申告額がこれに達しない場合は、農民が自らの労力と費用をかけて算定した地価を否定し強圧的に変更させたことから、伊勢暴動をはじめとした大規模な暴動が各地で頻発した。
sen.e: Among these, prefectural governments made average tanshu (production per tan), which land-tax reform office previously figured out, absolute assessment condition and if the declared value did not reach this, the governments forcibly made the land price, which the farmers calculated with their labor and cost, changed and thus large-scale riots often happened in various areas, such as the Ise Revolt and so on.

In this aggressive approach, each prefectural government made the average yield per tan that the Land Tax Reform Bureau figured out beforehand be the absolute condition of assessment and in case the reported amount was under the average tan that the Land Tax Reform Bureau figured out, each prefecture denied the reported value of the land, of which farmers assessed with their own labor and expenses and made the value of the land change forcibly; for this reason, including the Ise Revolt large scale riots erupted frequently in various places.
sen.cmt: 原文の直訳の「Among these」が何を意味しているのか漠然としていて不明です。
sen.e: In this aggressive approach, each prefectural government made the average yield per tan that the Land Tax Reform Bureau figured out beforehand be the absolute condition of assessment and in case the reported amount was under the average tan that the Land Tax Reform Bureau figured out, each prefecture denied the reported value of the land, of which farmers assessed with their own labor and expenses and made the value of the land change forcibly; for this reason, including the Ise Revolt large scale riots erupted frequently in various places.

sen.j: （地租改正反対一揆）これをうけて政府は、1月に、地租を100分の3から100分の2.5に減額することを決定した。

(Peasant revolts against the land-tax reform) In response to these revolts, the governments decided to lower the land-tax rate from 3 percent to 2.5 percent.
sen.cmt: 反対一揆は複数回起こっています。また「地租改正反対一揆」の訳が登録されている訳と違います。
sen.e: (Peasant revolts against the land-tax reform) In response to these revolts, the governments decided to lower the land-tax rate from 3 percent to 2.5 percent.

sen.j: その後政府の強硬姿勢は、頃まで続いたが、税収の見込みがつくようになると徐々に緩和されていき、に耕地宅地の改正作業が完了した。
sen.e: Later, the government's firm attitude continued, but with the prospect of tax revenue, the attitude was gradually eased and revision work of cultivated area and residential area were completed.

sen.e: The hardline stance of the government continued through 1878; but the strict stance was gradually eased as the government was able to have the prospect of receiving revenue from tax and the work of reformation of arable land and the residential land was completed in 1880.

sen.j: 収穫量の代わりに、収穫力に応じて決められた地価を課税標準とした。
sen.e: Instead of crop yields, the land price was decided by crop yields power and was the tax levy standard.
The basis of taxation was not the actual crop yield but the cash value of the land based on harvest potential.

sen.e: By specifying a certain tax rate for land price, tax revenue did not fluctuate by the crop yields of agricultural crops like before and the government could secure stable tax revenue.

sen.e: And by the policy of 'not decreasing traditional tax revenue,' a high tax rate of 3％ was calculated (when Takayoshi KIDO, who was an advocate of land-tax reform, heard of this high tax rate, he objected to this until the last minute, saying that it forced farmers to harder situation than that of shogunate system.

sen.j: これは結果的には大多数の農民の負担を高めることにつながり、また土地の所有者がおらず納税が困難な入会地が事実上、政府に没収されたことなどから伊勢暴動、真壁暴動など一揆（地租改正反対一揆）が頻発し、自由民権運動へ影響を与えた。
sen.e: This eventually led to the increase of burdens of majority of farmers and iriaichi (common land), where tax payment was difficult because there were no land owners, was virtually confiscated by the government and so on, and thus uprisings (against land-tax reform) such as the Ise Revolt, the Makabe Revolt and so on often happened, and this influenced Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right).

In terms of the consequence, this high tax rate resulted in increasing the burden of majority of the farmers; therefore, peasant revolts against the land-tax reform erupted including the Ise Revolt, Makabe Revolt; the part of the reason these revolts occurred lied in that the government virtually confiscated common land (iriaichi) from which the government could not expect to receive taxes; these revolts gave influence to the Jiyu MInken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right).

For this reason, the government lowered the tax rate from 3% to 2.5% as mentioned earlier and it was Toshimichi OKUBO who advanced his opinion on lowering the rate to the government because he was afraid of the collusion of the revolts of samurai or ancestors of samurai and peasants' revolts.

sen.j: 土地の私的所有の開始
sen.e: The beginning of private landownership.
The beginning of private landownership.

sen.j: 地券の発行により、個人に対する土地の私的所有が認められることとなった。
sen.e: By issuing of certificate of land title, private landownership for individuals was approved.
The issuing of certificates of land titles led to recognition of private landownership.

sen.j: この結果、土地は天皇のものであり、臣民は天皇または領主からその使用を許されているに過ぎないと考える公地公民制思想（王土王民説）や封建領主による領主権や村などの地域共同体による共同保有といった封建制度的な土地保有形態が完全に崩壊し、土地にも保有者個人の所有権が存在する事が初めて法的に認められることになり、土地が個人の財産として流通や担保の対象として扱われるようになった。
sen.e: As a result, the idea of complete state ownership of land and citizens, where lands belonged to the Emperor and the subjects were just allowed to use the lands by the Emperor or landlords, or feudalistic landownership form such as the feudal rights by suzerain or cooperative ownership by villages and so on, completely collapsed and the landownership of individual owners was legally admitted for the first time and the lands came to be treated as individual assets or objects of circulation or collateral.

As a result, the idea in that all land was under the sole ownership of the emperor and individuals were merely borrowing the land from the emperor or the idea in that feudal lords had the land ownership or the idea of cooperative ownership by local communities such as villages were completely collapsed; private land ownership by individuals was recognized legally for the first time in Japan; and land came to be treated as the objects of circulation or collateral as the property of individuals.
sen.cmt: 原文に「地主」 (landlords) は出てきません。
sen.e: As a result, the idea in that all land was under the sole ownership of the emperor and individuals were merely borrowing the land from the emperor or the idea in that feudal lords had the land ownership or the idea of cooperative ownership by local communities such as villages were completely collapsed; private land ownership by individuals was recognized legally for the first time in Japan; and land came to be treated as the objects of circulation or collateral as the property of individuals.

sen.j: その意味で、地租改正は日本における資本主義体制の確立を基礎づける重要な一歩であるといえる。
sen.e: In this sense, land-tax reform is said to have been an important first step for establishing the base of capitalistic system in Japan.
In this sense, it can be said that land-tax reform is the first important step in establishing the foundation of capitalism system in Japan.

sen.e: In this sense, it can be said that land-tax reform is the first important step in establishing the foundation of capitalism system in Japan.

sen.j: なお、地租改正に先立って、政府は、に田畑永代売買禁止令を解除して既に形骸化していた土地の売買禁止の合法化を行い、には地所質入書入規則及び動産不動産書入金穀貸借規則を定めて土地を担保とした貸借も合法化した。
sen.e: And before land-tax reform, the government lifted denpata-eitai-baibai-kinshi-rei (a ban on buying and selling fields [of rice and other crops]), legalized the ban on buying and selling lands, which had already lost substance, and also legalized the borrowing and lending with lands as collateral, setting the regulations on pawing and listing real states and the regulations on listing money for rental of crops for movable assets and real estates.

sen.e: In addition, before land-tax reform, the government legalized buying and selling of land by lifting the prohibition of sale and purchase of farming land which was already lacked in substance in 1872; in 1873 the government also legalized the borrowing and lending of money by using land as collateral by setting the regulations on pawing and listing real estates and regulations on listing movable property and real estate property for borrowing and lending of money and goods.

sen.j: 従来の藩が租税として集めた米をまとめて江戸や大坂の蔵屋敷を経由して同地の米問屋に売却するというこれまでの米の流通システムが崩壊して、個々の農民が地元の米商人などに直接米を換金してその代金を納め、地元の米商人が全国市場に米を売却するようになるなど、商業や流通に対する影響も大きかった。
sen.e: The traditional circulation system of rice collapsed, where traditional clans collected rice as tax and sold to warehouse merchant of rice in the same place through Kurayashiki (Warehouse-residence) in Edo or Osaka, and individual farmers changed rice directly to money by the local rice merchants and so on and paid and the local rice merchants sold rice in the markets across the country and so on, which largely influenced commerce and circulation.

The land-tax reform also had a large effect on Japanese commerce and distribution system; that is, prior to the reform rice collected as tax from various clans were sold and distributed by wholesale dealers in Edo or Osaka through storehouses of various clans in Edo or Osaka; the reform allowed farmers to change their rice to cash directly at local rice merchants, who sold rice to the market across the country; thus the previous distribution system collapsed.

sen.j: 例えば、地租の算定における一般的な農家の経営の基準を商業生産的な家族経営による拡大再生産が行われている農家とし、また地主と小作人は自由契約による小作関係によって成立しており小作料の増減は地租の増減に対応することを前提として立法された。
sen.e: For example, the standard of management of common farming household in calculation of land-tax was made to be a farming household in which expanded reproduction was done by family-run commercial production, and landlords and tenant farmers were linked by free contract tenant farming, and the increase and decrease of farm rent was legalized on the assumption that it corresponded to the increase and decrease of land-tax.

sen.j: これは実際には「生かさぬように殺さぬように」という発想で再生産が抑圧され、地主の地位が強力であった日本の農業社会の実態に合わず、また実際の地租算定においても生産経費を実際よりも低く見積もられたために、高率の税率も重なって地租が生産経費を圧迫し、小作料を跳ね上げる（当時の物価水準では収穫の1/3近くが地価の3％に相当し、更に地主が利潤を上乗せするために、結果的に小作料が上昇した）結果をもたらした。
sen.e: In fact, this did not fit to actual agricultural society in Japan, where reproduction was suppressed with the idea that 'not to make them alive or dead' and the status of landlords was strong, and also in actual calculation of land-tax, production expense was estimated to be lower than that of reality and with a high tax rate, land-tax oppressed the production expense and as a result heightened farm rent (in the price level in those days, nearly one thirds of crop yields corresponded to 3％ of land-tax and furthermore, landlords tacked on their profits and thus farm rent increased).

In fact, this assumption proved to be incorrect in the Japanese agricultural society where the position of landowners were strong and reproduction was suppressed under the idea of 'let the farmers live only well enough to work but don't kill them'; In addition, because the production expense was estimated lower than the expense required in the actual calculation of land-tax, together with high tax rate, land-tax put pressure on the production expense and as the result, the land-tax made the farm rent jump; (in the price level at the time, nearly the one third of the crop yield was equivalent to the 3% of the land price, and because the landowners added their profit on top of this, the farm rent increased as the result).

sen.e: Moreover, in the regulation of land-tax which was established later replacing the regulation of land-tax reform, the provision, in which the intention of lowering the tax rate was stated, had been deleted by the government.

sen.j: このことが自由民権運動や初期帝国議会における激しい政府批判を招き、また地租に替わる財源として酒造税の相次ぐ増税の一因となった。
sen.e: This invited a fierce criticism against the government in Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right) or the early Imperial Diet and let to the continued raise of brewery tax as financial resource instead of land-tax.

This deletion of the provision invited Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right) and fierce criticisms against the government in the initial Imperial Diet; in addition, it became a cause of a series of tax increase of brewery tax as the financial resource to replace land-tax.
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: This deletion of the provision invited Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right) and fierce criticisms against the government in the initial Imperial Diet; in addition, it became a cause of a series of tax increase of brewery tax as the financial resource to replace land-tax.

sen.j: 地券の作成
sen.e: Making of certificate of land title.
Making of certificate of land title.
Making of certificate of land title.

sen.j: 地租改正の際に行われた測量結果は地券に記され、この内容は地券台帳にまとめられた。
sen.e: The result of measurement when in land-tax reform was described in certificate of land title and this content was summarized in the note of certificate of land title.
A result of the land surveys implemented by the land-tax reform was recorded on the certificate of land title and the content was recorded in a registry of certificate of land title.
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: A result of the land surveys implemented by the land-tax reform was recorded on the certificate of land title and the content was recorded in a registry of certificate of land title.

sen.j: 地券は、土地所有を公証し、かつ納税義務者を表示するものとされ、また土地売買の法的手段であるとされたことから、土地の流通および土地金融はすべて地券により行われることとなった。
sen.e: Certificate of land title notarized landownership and indicated tax debtors and was regarded as legal measures for selling and buying lands and thus circulation of lands and land finance were all done by certificate of land title.

Certificate of land title notarized landownership and indicated tax debtors and was regarded as legal measures for selling and buying lands and thus circulation of lands and land finance were all done by certificate of land title.

Certificate of land title notarized landownership and indicated tax debtors and was regarded as legal measures for selling and buying lands and thus circulation of lands and land finance were all done by certificate of land title.

sen.j: の登記法成立後は、不動産登記登記簿が土地所有を公証するものとされた。
sen.e: After the enactment of recording acts, immovable property registration notarized landownership.
sen.cmt: 「の登記法成立後」の「の」はなしとしました。
sen.e: After the Real Property Registration Act was enacted in 1885, the registry of real property became that which to notarize the land ownership.
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。またウィキペディアの「地租改正」のページを参照すると、「の」前は「1885年」になっていましたので、この「1885年」を入れて訳しました。
sen.e: After the Real Property Registration Act was enacted in 1885, the registry of real property became that which to notarize the land ownership.

sen.j: また、地券台帳自体も、に創設された土地台帳制度に引き継がれ、に事実上廃止されて、以後地租の収税はこの土地台帳によって行われた。
sen.e: Also, the note of certificate of land title was succeeded to the established cadaster system and was virtually abolished and after that, collection of land-tax was done by this cadaster.
sen.cmt: 「に創設された」の「に」、「に事実上廃止されて」の「に」、ともになしとしました。
sen.e: In addition, the registry of certificate of land title itself was succeeded by cadaster system which was found in 1884; and in 1889 the registry system of certificate of the land title was virtually abolished; afterwards, collection of land-tax was carried out by this cadaster system.
sen.cmt: ウィキピデアの「地租改正」のページを参照すると、最初の「に」の前には「1884年」が入り、次の「に」 の前には「1889年」が入っています。それで、この「1884年」と「1889年」を入れて訳しました。
sen.e: In addition, the registry of certificate of land title itself was succeeded by cadaster system which was found in 1884; and in 1889 the registry system of certificate of the land title was virtually abolished; afterwards, collection of land-tax was carried out by this cadaster system.

sen.j: さらに土地台帳は登記簿と一元化されることで、に廃止された。
sen.e: Furthermore, cadaster was unified with registration and abolished.
sen.cmt: 「に廃止された」の「に」はなしとしました。
sen.e: Furthermore, the cadaster was to be unified with registry and came to be abolished in 1960.
sen.cmt: ウィキピデアの「地租改正」のページを参照すると、「に廃止された」の前に「1960年」が入っています。それで「1960年」を入れて訳しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, the cadaster was to be unified with registry and came to be abolished in 1960.

sen.j: このとき、土地台帳に記載されていた土地の表示に関する記載（所在、地番、地目、地積）が登記簿の表題部に移記された。
sen.e: At that time, the description on the indication of lands listed on cadaster (address, lot number, land classification and acreage) was transferred to the title part of registration.
At that time, the description on the indication of lands listed on cadaster (address, lot number, land classification and acreage) was transferred to the title part of registry.
sen.cmt: 「登記簿」の訳は以下のサイトによると「registry」です。http://www.japaneselawtranslation.go.jp/law/detail/?ft=1&re=01&dn=1&co=01&ky=%E4%B8%8D%E5%8B%95%E7%94%A3%E7%99%BB%E8%A8%98%E6%B3%95&page=1
sen.e: At that time, the description on the indication of lands listed on cadaster (address, lot number, land classification and acreage) was transferred to the title part of registry.

sen.j: したがって、現在の土地登記は、もとは地租改正時に作成された地券及び地券台帳にさかのぼるものであるといえる。
sen.e: Thus, current land registration is said to have gone back to certificate of land title and the note of certificate of land title made when in land-tax reform.

Therefore, it can be said that current registry of land goes back to the original certificate of land title and the registry of the certificate of land title created when land-tax reform was implemented.
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: Therefore, it can be said that current registry of land goes back to the original certificate of land title and the registry of the certificate of land title created when land-tax reform was implemented.

sen.j: しかしながら、地租改正当時の測量技術が未熟であったこと、時間と人員の制約から測量の専門家でない素人が測量にあたったこと、また税の軽減を図るために故意に過小に測量したことなどから、その内容は必ずしも正確なものではなかった。
sen.e: However, the contents were not precise because the technique of measurement was an unskilled one, amateurs, who were not measurement experts, did the measurement works because of constraints of time and human resource and they purposefully underestimated the lands in order to deduce the tax.

However, the details of survey at the time of land-tax reform were not necessarily accurate; it was because the survey technique used was primitive, people who were not the specialists for survey engaged in the task owning to the constraints of time and human resources, and there existed people who deliberately underestimated their land to deduce tax.
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: However, the details of survey at the time of land-tax reform were not necessarily accurate; it was because the survey technique used was primitive, people who were not the specialists for survey engaged in the task owning to the constraints of time and human resources, and there existed people who deliberately underestimated their land to deduce tax.

sen.j: このことが、現在の登記簿においても、登記簿と実際の地形や測量面積が一致しないこと（いわゆる「縄伸び」「縄縮み」）の原因となっている。
sen.e: This leads to disagreement between the registration and actual landform or measured square footage in current registration (so-called 'nawanobi,' 'nawachijimi').

This inaccurate survey resulted in disagreement between the record in the registry and the actual topographical shape of the land or the surveyed area; (these inaccuracies are referred to 'nawa nobi' (rope stretching) and 'nawa chijimi' (rope shrinking).
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: This inaccurate survey resulted in disagreement between the record in the registry and the actual topographical shape of the land or the surveyed area; (these inaccuracies are referred to 'nawa nobi' (rope stretching) and 'nawa chijimi' (rope shrinking).

sen.j: 現在、正確な登記簿を作るべく地籍調査が全国的に進められている。
sen.e: At present, acreage survey was advanced across the country in order to make precise registration.
Currently, nationwide land registry investigation is underway to create an accurate registry.
sen.cmt: 正確性に問題があります。
sen.e: Currently, nationwide land registry investigation is underway to create an accurate registry.
